direction.raw_text: Where is this coming from? Barbara heads up the porch steps and into -- 88   INT. THE WESTON HOUSE/KITCHEN - DAY                             88 BARBARA Lot of fish in the sea. Surely you can rule out the one single man in the world you're related to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love the man I'm related to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck love, what a crock of shit. People can convince themselves they love a painted rock. They find Johnna cooking in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks great. What is it? "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   125. 88   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Catfish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bottom feeders, my favorite. You're nearly fifty years old, Ivy, you can't go to New York, you'll break a hip. Eat your catfish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have lived in this town, year in and year out, hoping against hope someone would come into my life--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get all Carson McCullers on me. Now wipe that tragic look off your face and eat some catfish. They head into the dining room, find Violet smoking, working on her jigsaw puzzle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howdy, Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's howdy about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, catfish for lunch.   Johnna! (to Violet) You hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ivy, you should smile.   Like me. Johnna enters from the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom needs her lunch, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't eaten anything today. You didn't eat anything yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why aren't either of you dressed?                      * "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   126. 88   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * We're dressed. We're not sitting here                   * naked, are we?                                          *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...                                                 * Johnna reenters with plates, then goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat it.    Mom? Eat it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat it, you fucker.   Eat that catfish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't cut any fucking ice with me. Now eat that fucking fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I have something to talk to you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you don't. Shut up.    Shut the fuck up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's to talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom-- "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   127. 88   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it.     Eat that fucking fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I need to--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, fuck it, do what you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to tell you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ivy's a lesbian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you are. Did you eat your fish?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara, stop it! "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   128. 88   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat your fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat your fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara, quiet now--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, please, this is important -- BARBARA Eatyourfisheatyourfisheatyourfish-- Ivy stands, hurls her plate of food, smashes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck -- IVY I have something to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we breaking shit? Barbara takes a vase from the sideboard, smashes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `cause I can break shit -- Violet throws her plate, smashes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, we can all break shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles and I -- BARBARA You don't want to break shit with me, muthah-fuckah -- IVY Charles and I -- BARBARA Johnna?!   Little spill in here! Ivy gets in Barbara's face. "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   129. 88   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara, stop it! (returning to Violet) Mom, Charles and I -- BARBARA Little Charles -- IVY Charles and I -- BARBARA Little Charles -- IVY Barbara -- BARBARA You have to say Little Charles or she won't know who you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Charles and I... Barbara relents.      Ivy will finally get to say the words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Charles and I are -- VIOLET Little Charles and you are brother and sister. I know that. Freeze.   Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?    No, listen, Little Charles -- VIOLET I've always known that. I told you, no one slips anything by me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom -- BARBARA Don't listen. "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   130. 88   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew the whole time Bev and Mattie Fae were carrying on. Charlie should have known too, if he wasn't smoking all that grass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the pills talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father tore himself up over it, thirty some-odd years, but Beverly wouldn't have been Beverly if he didn't have plenty to brood about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, what are you...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh honey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better you girls know now though, now you're older. Never know when someone might need a kidney. Ivy looks from Violet to Barbara... suddenly lurches away from the table, knocking over her chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why in God's name did you tell me this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what do you care?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're monsters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on now -- IVY Monsters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's the injured party here? Ivy flees from the dining room, pursued by Barbara -- "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft    131. 89   INT. FRONT HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS                               89 BARBARA Ivy, listen -- IVY Leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Mattie Fae told me, I didn't know what to do -- Ivy runs from the house. 90   EXT. WESTON HOUSE - CONTINUOUS                                90 Ivy rushes to her car, still followed by Barbara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was trying to protect you -- IVY We'll go anyway, we'll still go away. Ivy gets in the car, starts it, revs the engine.    Barbara tries to open the car door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not my fault. Barbara pounds on the car window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't tell you, Mom told you! It wasn't me, it was Mom! The car window slides down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no difference. Ivy floors the car, roars out of the driveway, leaving Barb standing there. After a moment, Barb turns, stares up at the house, angry, resolute. Starts back inside. 91   INT. WESTON HOUSE - CONTINUOUS                                91 Finds Violet still at the table, lighting a cigarette. "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   132. 91   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We couldn't let Ivy run off with Little Charles. Just wouldn't be right. Barbara doesn't respond, keeps her distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll be back. She's a sweet girl, Ivy, and I love her to death. But she isn't strong. Not like you. Or me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew about Daddy and Mattie Fae?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sure. I never told them I knew. But your father knew. He knew I knew. But we never talked about it. I chose the higher ground. (and then) If I'd had the chance, there at the end, I would've told him, "I hope this isn't about Little Charles, cause you know I know all about that." If I'd reached him at that motel, I would've said, "You'd be better off if you quit sulking about this ancient history."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...what motel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called over there on Monday after I got into that safety deposit box. But it was too late, he'd checked out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know where he was? Violet is growing agitated with the interrogation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The note. He said I could call him over at the Country Squire Motel -- BARBARA He left a note?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I did, I called him on Monday. "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft       133. 91   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After you got the money out of your                       * safety deposit box...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had an arrangement. You have to                        * understand, for people like your                          * father and me, who never had any                          * money, ever, as kids, people from our                     * generation, that money is important.                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you could've stopped Daddy from                        * killing himself, you wouldn't have                        * needed to get into your safety deposit                    * box.                                                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hindsight's always twenty-                          * twenty, isn't it?                                         * Barbara stares at her mother for a long moment.       Then -- BARBARA Did the note say he was going to kill himself? No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had my wits about me, I might've done it different. But I was, your father and me both, we were... Barbara looks off, quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were both fucked-up... You were                       * fucked-up... You are fucked-up.                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better understand this, you smug little ingrate. There's only one reason Beverly killed himself and that's you. Think there's any way he would've done what he did if you were still here? No, just him and me, here in this house, in the dark, left to ourselves, abandoned, wasted lifetimes devoted to your care and comfort. (MORE) "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   134. 91   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So stick that knife of judgment in me, go ahead, but make no mistake, his blood is just as much on your hands as it is on mine. Barbara is reeling, trying to comprehend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did this though, not us. Can you imagine anything more cruel, to make me responsible? Just to weaken me, make me prove my character? So I waited, to get my hands on that safety deposit box. But I would have waited anyway. You want to show who's stronger, Bev? Nobody's stronger than me, goddamn it. When nothing is left, when everything is gone and disappeared, I'll be here. Violet YELLS up to the empty house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's stronger now, you son-of-a- bitch?! Barbara feels sick, the floor giving away beneath her.       She takes a moment. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right, Mom.    You're the strong one. She goes to her mother, kisses her. Turns, heads into the hall, grabs her purse and Bev's keys from the dish. Violet only slowly realizes Barbara's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Barbara? Hears the sound of the screen door opening and SLAPPING shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara? Violet follows her into the hall, stops at the screen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and me. We're alike. Barb doesn't turn around, keeps moving.         Quietly: "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft   135. 91   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... Sees Barb heading across the yard for Beverly's pick-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm nothing like you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Barbara. Watches Barbara climb into the truck, back slowly out, go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Barbara? Barbara drives off. The driveway now empty again. Violet alone outside on the walkway. She turns back to the house, yelling, moving from empty room to empty room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ivy?!    Ivy, you here?! Silence.   The dining room, the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barb?!   Ivy?! And into the living room, Bev's study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bev?! ...Bev?! She stumbles to the stereo, puts on her Clapton... stares at the spinning album...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnna?! She reels to the stairs, crawling up -- 92   INT/EXT. BEVERLY'S PICK-UP (MOVING) - DAY                       92 Barbara is nearly catatonic as she drives, the house receding in the rear window behind her. A few large rain drops splatter her windshield, the rumble of distant thunder, lightning and towering, ominous clouds in the distance. "August" 9/21/12 FINAL WHITE Draft    136. 93   INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY/ATTIC STAIRS - DAY                      93 Violet climbs the staircase on all fours.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jean--                            Let me go! Jean pulls free, runs off.    Bill gets in Barbara's face.
